refsection.title: Calling a scilab function (macros) from a C interface

para.warning: WARNING: This API is deprecated from Scilab 5.2.0 and is going to be removed with Scilab 6.0. Please use API Scilab (the new Scilab API).

refsection.para: When you write a interface with scilab, you can need to call another function directly from your function. You can pass a pointer on scilab function to your function.
The source files of this example are stored in the directory examples/call_scifunction.
refsection.programlisting: exec call_scifunction.sce; // launch scilab v = call_scifunc(30,12,scilabfoo);
refsection.para: you pass a pointer on a scilab function (scilabfoo macro) to your function 'call_scifunc'.
C2F(scifunction) calls another scilab function (here scilabfoo).
